![Chuncheon Myeongdong Street (Ï∂òÏ≤ú Î™ÖÎèôÍ±∞Î¶¨)](/2022-07-25-1658757394112/2030528_image2_1.webp) ## Overview > The street was named after Seoul‚Äôs Myeong-dong street as it became the main street of Chuncheon. Government offices, such as Gangwon-do Provincial Office and Chuncheon City Hall, and major banks are located nearby the street, and various shops specialized in clothes, cosmetics, and shoes, as well as cafes and restaurants are located in the street. The sculpture built to remember the street as the filming location for the Korean TV drama Winter Sonata is located in the middle of Myeongdong Street. In addition, the street has large shopping malls, such as M Department Store and Brown 5th Avenue, cinema, and other attractions. The large-scale underground shopping center established based on the Jungang Rotary, houses some 350 stores where customers can enjoy shopping and relaxation in any weather. The Myeongdong Street connects to other Chuncheon‚Äôs tourist destinations, including Myeongdong Dakgalbi Alley of Chuncheon, Yungnim Pass, and Chuncheon Jungang Market. ## Intro | | | | - | - | |infocenter:|‚Ä¢ 1330 Travel Hotline: +82-2-1330
(English, Korean, Japanese, Chinese)
‚Ä¢ For more info: +82-33-250-3089| ## Detail Image ![/2022-07-25-1658757394112/2030526_image2_1.webp](/2022-07-25-1658757394112/2030526_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-07-25-1658757394112/2030527_image2_1.webp](/2022-07-25-1658757394112/2030527_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-07-25-1658757394112/2030529_image2_1.webp](/2022-07-25-1658757394112/2030529_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-07-25-1658757394112/2030530_image2_1.webp](/2022-07-25-1658757394112/2030530_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-07-25-1658757394112/2030532_image2_1.webp](/2022-07-25-1658757394112/2030532_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-07-25-1658757394112/2030533_image2_1.webp](/2022-07-25-1658757394112/2030533_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-07-25-1658757394112/2495147_image2_1.webp](/2022-07-25-1658757394112/2495147_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-07-25-1658757394112/2495151_image2_1.webp](/2022-07-25-1658757394112/2495151_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-07-25-1658757394112/619243_image2_1.webp](/2022-07-25-1658757394112/619243_image2_1.webp) ## Contact - [‚òéÔ∏è+82-33-250-3089](tel:+82332503089) - [üè†tour.chuncheon.go.kr](http://tour.chuncheon.go.kr/) ```googleMap latitude: 37.8800481627 longitude: 127.7275492614 title: 55, Jungang-ro, Chuncheon-si, Gangwon-do ``` ## Directions [Bus]
Take bus 7, 9, 64, or 64-2 across from Chuncheon Intercity Bus Terminal.
Get off at Myeong-dong Bus Stop. (10 min ride)

[Subway]
Chuncheon Station (Gyeongchun Line)
Take bus 63 and get off at Myeong-dong Bus Stop. (10 min ride)

data.title: Chuncheon Myeongdong Street (Ï∂òÏ≤ú Î™ÖÎèôÍ±∞Î¶¨)
data.description: The street was named after Seoul‚Äôs Myeong-dong street as it became the main street of Chuncheon. Government offices, such as Gangwon-do Provincial Office and Chuncheon City Hall, and major banks are located nearby the street, and various shops specialized in clothes, cosmetics, and shoes, as well as cafes and restaurants are located in the street. The sculpture built to remember the street as the filming location for the Korean TV drama Winter Sonata is located in the middle of Myeongdong Street. In addition, the street has large shopping malls, such as M Department Store and Brown 5th Avenue, cinema, and other attractions. The large-scale underground shopping center established based on the Jungang Rotary, houses some 350 stores where customers can enjoy shopping and relaxation in any weather. The Myeongdong Street connects to other Chuncheon‚Äôs tourist destinations, including Myeongdong Dakgalbi Alley of Chuncheon, Yungnim Pass, and Chuncheon Jungang Market.
data.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Gongjaksan Mountain (Í≥µÏûëÏÇ∞)
dataList.description:
Gongjaksan Mountain, spreading out from the peak with an altitude of 887.4 meters, resembles the outstretched wings of a peacock (gongjak in Korean). Looking out from the top of the mountain, the entirety of Hongcheon County can be seen, as well as beautifully shaped cliffs spread throughout.

Sutagyegok Valley is very picturesque with wonderful rock outcrops and surroundings. This 8 kilometer-long valley links Sutasa Temple, which is about 6 kilometers lower than the peak, to Nocheon-ri.

Something for nearly every season with royal azalea flowers in spring, old pine trees and colorful foliage in fall, and snow-covered trees in winter, Gongjaksan Mountains beauty catches the attention of hikers year-round.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Geumganggul Cave (Í∏àÍ∞ïÍµ¥)
dataList.description:
Hollowed into the rocks of Seoraksan Mountain, about 600 meters above sea level, you will find Geumganggul Cave. This 23 square meters cave was once used as a place of worship, and contains a stone sitting Buddha and some earthenware. The route up the cave is quite steep, and visitors must walk across a few bridges and up concrete stairways. However, you will be rewarded with a captivating view of Cheonbuldong Valley.

The hiking trail from Seorakdong to Geumganggul Cave, which also passes by Biseondae, is 3.6 kilometers long and takes about 1 hour and 40 minutes.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Geumdanggyegok Valley (Í∏àÎãπÍ≥ÑÍ≥°)
dataList.description:
Geumdanggyegok Valley, located upstream of the Pyeongchanggang River, is a gorge between three different districts of Bongpyeong-myeon, Yongpyeong-myeon and Daehwa-myeon, just west of Geumdangsan Mountain (1,173 m). Geumdanggyegok Valley is an impressive site with sections of both gentle and fast flowing valley waters. From late March through April full-blown azalea covers the mountainsides and valleys providing visitors with a refreshing spring scent.

To reach Geumdanggyegok Valley, travel down along the Pyeongchanggang River from Jangpyeong or trek up the valley from Anmi Elementary School. Coming down to Pyeongchang-eup from Daehwa-myeon area, visitors will encounter an intersection called, ‚ÄúSaechugeori‚Äù. The intersection has two parts Sanganmi and Haanmiri and a sign indicating the Geumdanggyegok Valley entrance. Across the valley, odd-shaped rock formations and cliffs appear one after another along the river. The area is a native habitat for a species of otter (Natural Treasure No. 330) and a favorite spot for catching catfish.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Geombongsan Recreational Forest (Í≤ÄÎ¥âÏÇ∞ÏûêÏó∞Ìú¥ÏñëÎ¶º)
dataList.description: Geombongsan Mountain (alt. 681.6 m) poses an exciting challenge for mountain bike enthusiasts. The mountain ridge is covered with varied flower species including royal azaleas, iris, polygala, and violets. The summit of Geombongsan Mountain offers views of the boundless sea to the east, the sharply rising Eungbongsan Mountain (alt. 998.5 m) to the south, and the slightly taller Sageumsan Mountain (alt. 1,092 m) to the west. The mountain is only a 5 to 10-minute-drive from Imwon Beach, which makes a great summer vacation destination.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Gariwangsan National Recreational Forest (Íµ≠Î¶Ω Í∞ÄÎ¶¨ÏôïÏÇ∞ÏûêÏó∞Ìú¥ÏñëÎ¶º)
dataList.description: Gariwangsan Mountain is one of the major mountains in the Taebaek Mountain Range. It is a home to numerous alpine tree species, as well as wildflowers and herbs. Its trails are popular thanks to the gentle slopes. Gariwangsan National Recreational Forest is located at the Hoedong-ri Village entrance. The recreational forest has various amenities, but the walking path next to the valley is by far the most outstanding. The thick forest blocks out the sky while purifying the air.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Garisan Recreational Forest (Í∞ÄÎ¶¨ÏÇ∞ÏûêÏó∞Ìú¥ÏñëÎ¶º)
dataList.description: Located on Garisan Mountain, the Garisan Recreational Forest offers marvelous scenery of a rich forest, old pine trees, and uniquely shaped rocks. The forest is equipped with various recreational, accommodation and convenience facilities including campsites, wood cabin, forest walking trails, swimming pool, sports facilities, and outdoor cooking facilities.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Gangwon Yongchupokpo Falls (Î¨¥Î¶âÍ≥ÑÍ≥° Ïö©Ï∂îÌè≠Ìè¨(Í∞ïÏõê))
dataList.description: Located approximately 2.5 kilometers west of Samhwasa Temple, the entrance of Mureunggyegok Valley, Yongchupokpo Falls is a three section waterfall in a shape of a pot that gets its waters from Cheongoksan Mountain (1,403.7 meters). Located 70 meters below Yongchupokpo Falls is Ssangpokpo Falls, where the water from Yongchupokpo Falls and Bakdalgyegok Valley meets to create a deep and beautiful base.
dataList.author: korea-tour
